subject: Re: [junit] Not able to run junit test case
msgSnippet: Pradeep , How are you running the tests? I d guess you are using a test runner from JUnit 3.8.1 and not 4.x. As a quick test, add the following method to your
messageBody:
Pradeep ,

How are you running the tests? I'd guess you are using a test runner from JUnit 3.8.1 and not 4.x.

As a quick test, add the following method to your class and if it runs, then that's your problem:

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(Employee.class);
}

It might also be the case that JUnit is confused because you've inherited from TestCase and not followed the naming conventions (testX, testY, etc.). Not sure about that.

If you use the annotations, you do not need to inherit from TestCase. Of course by doing so you get all of the Assert methods. You can either use static imports for those or inherit from Assert (ugly but given the tool support, a reasonable alternative in my opinion).


Brett

Tutorials and Articles
http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/



----- Original Message ----
From: pradeep_3diitr <pradeep_3diitr@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, July 17, 2006 6:54:12 AM
Subject: [junit] Not able to run junit test case


Hi,

I am getting following error while running a Junit TestCase whose
format conforms to new style (@Test, etc):

No tests found in org.MyCompany. EmployeeTest

junit.framework. AssertionFailedE rror: No tests found in
org.MyCompany. EmployeeTest at
org.junit.internal. runners.OldTestC lassRunner. run
(OldTestClassRunner .java:35) at junit.framework. JUnit4TestAdapte r.run
(JUnit4TestAdapter. java:32)

I know this is happening because of annotations being used.

Could you please resolve this ASAP.

Following is the TestCase -->

package org.MyCompany;

import org.MyCompany. Employee;

import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner. RunWith;
import org.junit.runners. Parameterized;
import org.junit.runners. Parameterized. Parameters;
import org.junit.Assert;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Ignore;

import org.junit.runner. Result;

import java.util.LinkedLis t;
import java.util.Iterator;

import junit.framework. JUnit4TestAdapte r;
import junit.framework. TestCase;

public class EmployeeTest extends TestCase
{
private Employee satendra;
private Employee pradeep;
private Employee sriram;

@Before
public void setUp()
{
satendra = new Employee("Satendra
Diwedi",30,50000, null);
pradeep = new Employee("Pradeep
Yadav",26,30000, satendra) ;
sriram = new Employee("Sriram
Sethumadhavan" ,26,35000, satendra) ;
}

@Test
public void GetName()
{
Assert.assertEquals ("Satendra
Diwedi",satendra. getName() );
Assert.assertEquals ("Pradeep Yadav",pradeep. getName
());
}

@Test
public void getAge()
{
Assert.assertEquals (26,sriram. getAge()) ;
}

@Test
public void getSalary()
{
Assert.assertEquals (30000.0, pradeep.getSalar y(),0);
}

@Test
public void raiseSalary( )
{
pradeep.raiseSalary (10);
Assert.assertEquals (33000.0, pradeep.getSalar y(),0);
}

@Test
public void getManager()
{
Assert.assertSame( satendra, pradeep.getManag er());
}

//@Ignore
@Test
public void getSubordinateList( )
{
LinkedList<Employee > l = satendra.getSubordi nateList
();

Iterator listIter = l.listIterator( );

Employee e;

e = (Employee)listIter. next();

Assert.assertSame( pradeep,e) ;

e = (Employee)listIter. next();

Assert.assertSame( sriram,e) ;
}

@After
public void tearDown()
{
satendra = null;
sriram = null;
pradeep = null;
}

public static junit.framework. Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter( EmployeeTest. class);
}

}

Regards,

Pradeep
